FeedItems.Title: Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary:
NuGet.org will begin requiring two-factor authentication for accounts starting March 8th.
The post Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org appeared first on The NuGet Blog.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add one-time message for claim id, adjust logic on temp id search" (#9253) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Let's fix that Claim Key message.

Also, there's a case in the search logic I wanted to filter out--if a customer uploads a package foo,  without this change it could still be viewed using https://www.nuget.org/packages/foo. This will prevent that case, as if a package has a TemporaryId, it will not be found by its actual ID.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add one-time message for claim id, adjust logic on temp id search" (#9253) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Alter landing displaypackage URL to use a temporary ID for anon uploads" (#9251) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
- changes the post-publish URL to use the temporary ID
- changes package lookup to use temporary ID first
- displays temporary ID on Display Package page, while leaving persistent metadata (actual ID, version) in page titles and publish message

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/191873924-49218f24-4045-4cfc-94db-52206da465ce.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Add caniuse images via bitsofco.de to trusted image domains" (#9252) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

We are offering Blazor wrapper packages for different web APIs. There is a great service called caniuse.com that shows the availability of a particular API on different platforms. Ire Aderinokun offers a service that shows the caniuse.com status data and MDN compat data in a (static) image, e.g.:

https://caniuse.bitsofco.de/image/async-clipboard.png ‚Üí https://res.cloudinary.com/ireaderinokun/image/upload/v1663850793397/caniuse-embed/all/async-clipboard.png

![](https://caniuse.bitsofco.de/image/async-clipboard.png)

Thus, I'd like to suggest adding either `caniuse.bitsofco.de` or the resolved version `res.cloudinary.com/ireaderinokun/*/caniuse-embed/all/*.png` to the allowlist.

### Repro Steps

Status image is currently not shown:

- https://www.nuget.org/packages/Thinktecture.Blazor.AsyncClipboard
- https://www.nuget.org/packages/Thinktecture.Blazor.WebShare

### Expected Behavior

Status image is shown.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "TelemetryUtility.IsVsOfflineFeed fails to correctly identify the local feed with 64-bit windows" (#12110) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "[DCR]: Change PackageReference restore algorithm to prevent redundant packages from being downloaded" (#12109) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

NuGet.exe, MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### Current Behavior

Currently when doing a package restore, Nuget will download packages that are eclipsed by newer versions if that newer version is not a direct dependency of a parent.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3144757/192067489-4fcf50a0-43c6-4a5c-b720-6b49e8173f7c.png)

In the example above, both LibC 1.0.0 and LibC 1.0.2 will be downloaded (but only 1.0.2 installed). However, LibB 1.0.0 will neither be downloaded nor installed since a newer version is a direct dependency of a parent node.

If you use a nuget Lock file, the restore is smarter and only downloads the packages that will be installed.

### Desired Behavior

Nuget should only download packages that will be installed, even without the presence of a lock file.

This may require changes to package servers to provide additional metadata about dependencies or to optionally do the dependency resolution entirely server-side (verified by the client).

### Additional Context

Component scanning tools can detect packages downloaded by nuget, even if not installed. This can make it difficult to remove components from a build.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: [Bug Bash][Localization] The translation of string ‚ÄúNuGet storage cleared at (current time)‚Äù in Options window is incorrect" (#12108) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.4.0.97

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\32922.386 (installed ‚ÄúChinese (Simplified)‚Äù language pack)
NuGet Version: Dev\6.4.0.97
OS Version: Windows-11-Enterprise-21H2 ENU

#### Detailed repro steps
1. Open VS, click menu Tools->Options->Environment->International Settings and select ‚Äú‰∏≠Êñá(ÁÆÄ‰Ωì)‚Äù in the ‚ÄúLanguage‚Äù dropdown list and restart VS.
2. Create a ‚ÄúC# Console App (.NET 7.0)‚Äù project in VS.
3. Right-Click the project in the Solution Explorer window and select ‚ÄòManage NuGet Packages‚Ä¶‚Äô.
4. Click the ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab and install some packages into this project.
5. Click the settings button on the top-right of PM UI to open the Options window.
6. Go to NuGet Package Manager->General tab and click the ‚ÄúClear All NuGet Storage‚Äù button.

#### Expected
The translation should be ‚ÄúÂú®9/23/2022 2:09:53 AMÂ∑≤Ê∏ÖÈô§NuGetÂ≠òÂÇ®‚Äù.

#### Actual 
The translation is incorrect as ‚ÄúÂ∑≤Ê∏ÖÈô§ 9/23/2022 2:09:53 AM Â§ÑÁöÑ NuGet Â≠òÂÇ®‚Äù since the ‚Äú9/23/2022 2:09:53 AM‚Äù is a time not a place.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/191941090-07ec2661-c05d-40fb-ac5e-f7234287c440.png)
#### Notes:
It doesn‚Äôt repro on D16.11\32802.440.


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: [Bug Bash] The info showing in Output window should be consistent with the one showing in Options window when clearing NuGet Storage" (#12107) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.4.0.97

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\32922.386
NuGet Version: Dev\6.4.0.97
OS Version: Windows-11-Enterprise-21H2 ENU

#### Detailed repro steps
1. Create a ‚ÄúC# Console App (.NET 7.0)‚Äù project in VS.
2. Right-Click the project in the Solution Explorer window and select ‚ÄòManage NuGet Packages‚Ä¶‚Äô.
3. Click the ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab and install some packages into this project.
4. Click the settings button on the top-right of PM UI to open the Options window.
5. Go to NuGet Package Manager->General tab and click the ‚ÄúClear All NuGet Storage‚Äù button.
6. Close the Options window after the clearing completed and go to Output window.
#### Expected
The info should be ‚ÄúNuGet storage cleared.‚Äù In Output window. 
#### Actual 
The info is ‚ÄúLocal resources cleared‚Äù in Output window. That‚Äôs inconsistent with the info showing in Options dialog as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/191940479-1fe14a71-b12a-4e86-b0fe-c127ef9f3ed3.png)
#### Notes:
It is not a regression since it reproes on D16.11\32802.440.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Connection] Deprecating legacy cipher suites at www.nuget.org" (#63) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
In order to provide a more secure and compliant environment for our customers, we are planning to deprecate legacy cipher suites and only support the following cipher suites at [www.nuget.org](http://www.nuget.org/):

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

Between 08/31/2022 07:00 PM UTC and 09/02/2022 07:00 PM UTC, we will take a test for this deprecation to understand the broken change for our customers. Based on our telemetry, we expect the impact to be minimal, but if you meet any connection issues at [www.nuget.org](http://www.nuget.org/) or have any questions, do reach out to us at‚ÄØ[support@nuget.org](mailto:support@nuget.org) or by commenting on the discussion issue: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9216. We will be closely monitoring our communication channels to assess any unexpected impact.
